ToolSpecification.name: use_aws
ToolSpecification.description: Make an AWS CLI api call with the specified service, operation, and parameters. All arguments MUST conform to the AWS CLI specification. Should the output of the invocation indicate a malformed command, invoke help to obtain the the correct command.

parameters.description: The parameters for the operation. The parameter keys MUST conform to the AWS CLI specification. You should prefer to use JSON Syntax over shorthand syntax wherever possible. For parameters that are booleans, prioritize using flags with no value. Denote these flags with flag names as key and an empty string as their value. You should also prefer kebab case.

region.description: Region name for calling the operation on AWS.

operation_name.description: The name of the operation to perform.

service_name.description: The name of the AWS service. If you want to query s3, you should use s3api if possible.

label.description: Human readable description of the api that is being called.

profile_name.description: Optional: AWS profile name to use from ~/.aws/credentials. Defaults to default profile if not specified.

ToolSpecification.name: dummy
ToolSpecification.description: This is a dummy tool. If you are seeing this that means the tool associated with this tool call is not in the list of available tools. This could be because a wrong tool name was supplied or the list of tools has changed since the conversation has started. Do not show this when user asks you to list tools.

ToolSpecification.name: execute_bash
ToolSpecification.description: Execute the specified bash command.

summary.description: A brief explanation of what the command does

ToolSpecification.name: fs_write
ToolSpecification.description:
A tool for creating and editing files
 * The `create` command will override the file at `path` if it already exists as a file, and otherwise create a new file
 * The `append` command will add content to the end of an existing file, automatically adding a newline if the file doesn't end with one. The file must exist.
 Notes for using the `str_replace` command:
 * The `old_str` parameter should match EXACTLY one or more consecutive lines from the original file. Be mindful of whitespaces!
 * If the `old_str` parameter is not unique in the file, the replacement will not be performed. Make sure to include enough context in `old_str` to make it unique
 * The `new_str` parameter should contain the edited lines that should replace the `old_str`.

file_text.description: Required parameter of `create` command, with the content of the file to be created.

new_str.description: Required parameter of `str_replace` command containing the new string. Required parameter of `insert` command containing the string to insert. Required parameter of `append` command containing the content to append to the file.

insert_line.description: Required parameter of `insert` command. The `new_str` will be inserted AFTER the line `insert_line` of `path`.

old_str.description: Required parameter of `str_replace` command containing the string in `path` to replace.

path.description: Absolute path to file or directory, e.g. `/repo/file.py` or `/repo`.

summary.description: A brief explanation of what the file change does or why it's being made.

command.description: The commands to run. Allowed options are: `create`, `str_replace`, `insert`, `append`.

ToolSpecification.name: report_issue
ToolSpecification.description: Opens the browser to a pre-filled gh (GitHub) issue template to report chat issues, bugs, or feature requests. Pre-filled information includes the conversation transcript, chat context, and chat request IDs from the service.

title.description: The title of the GitHub issue.

actual_behavior.description: Optional: The actual chat behavior that happened and demonstrates the issue or lack of a feature.

steps_to_reproduce.description: Optional: Previous user chat requests or steps that were taken that may have resulted in the issue or error response.

expected_behavior.description: Optional: The expected chat behavior or action that did not happen.

ToolSpecification.name: fs_read
ToolSpecification.description:
Tool for reading files (for example, `cat -n`),  directories (for example, `ls -la`) and images. If user has supplied paths that appear to be leading to images, you should use this tool right away using Image mode. The behavior of this tool is determined by the `mode` parameter. The available modes are:
- line: Show lines in a file, given by an optional `start_line` and optional `end_line`.
- directory: List directory contents. Content is returned in the "long format" of ls (that is, `ls -la`).
- search: Search for a pattern in a file. The pattern is a string. The matching is case insensitive.

Example Usage:
1. Read all lines from a file: command="line", path="/path/to/file.txt"
2. Read the last 5 lines from a file: command="line", path="/path/to/file.txt", start_line=-5
3. List the files in the home directory: command="line", path="~"
4. Recursively list files in a directory to a max depth of 2: command="line", path="/path/to/directory", depth=2
5. Search for all instances of "test" in a file: command="search", path="/path/to/file.txt", pattern="test"

mode.description: The mode to run in: `Line`, `Directory`, `Search`. `Line` and `Search` are only for text files, and `Directory` is only for directories. `Image` is for image files, in this mode `image_paths` is required.

depth.description: Depth of a recursive directory listing (optional, for Directory mode)

path.description: Path to the file or directory. The path should be absolute, or otherwise start with ~ for the user's home.

start_line.description: Starting line number (optional, for Line mode). A negative index represents a line number starting from the end of the file.

context_lines.description: Number of context lines around search results (optional, for Search mode)

pattern.description: Pattern to search for (required, for Search mode). Case insensitive. The pattern matching is performed per line.

image_paths.description: List of paths to the images. This is currently supported by the Image mode.

end_line.description: Ending line number (optional, for Line mode). A negative index represents a line number starting from the end of the file.

ToolSpecification.name: github___create_and_submit_pull_request_review
ToolSpecification.description: Create and submit a review for a pull request without review comments.

ToolSpecification.name: github___fork_repository
ToolSpecification.description: Fork a GitHub repository to your account or specified organization

ToolSpecification.name: github___add_pull_request_review_comment_to_pending_review
ToolSpecification.description: Add a comment to the requester's latest pending pull request review, a pending review needs to already exist to call this (check with the user if not sure).

startSide.description: For multi-line comments, the starting side of the diff that the comment applies to. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

side.description: The side of the diff to comment on. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

path.description: The relative path to the file that necessitates a comment

line.description: The line of the blob in the pull request diff that the comment applies to. For multi-line comments, the last line of the range

body.description: The text of the review comment

startLine.description: For multi-line comments, the first line of the range that the comment applies to

subjectType.description: The level at which the comment is targeted

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_code_scanning_alerts
ToolSpecification.description: List code scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

state.description: Filter code scanning alerts by state. Defaults to open

ref.description: The Git reference for the results you want to list.

severity.description: Filter code scanning alerts by severity

tool_name.description: The name of the tool used for code scanning.

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_code_scanning_alert
ToolSpecification.description: Get details of a specific code scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___update_pull_request_branch
ToolSpecification.description: Update the branch of a pull request with the latest changes from the base branch.

expectedHeadSha.description: The expected SHA of the pull request's HEAD ref

ToolSpecification.name: github___merge_pull_request
ToolSpecification.description: Merge a pull request in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_issue_comments
ToolSpecification.description: Get comments for a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_commits
ToolSpecification.description: Get list of commits of a branch in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

ToolSpecification.name: github___assign_copilot_to_issue
ToolSpecification.description:
Assign Copilot to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

This tool can help with the following outcomes:
- a Pull Request created with source code changes to resolve the issue


More information can be found at:
- https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/using-copilot-coding-agent-to-work-on-tasks/about-assigning-tasks-to-copilot

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_pull_request_status
ToolSpecification.description: Get the status of a specific pull request.

ToolSpecification.name: github___dismiss_notification
ToolSpecification.description: Dismiss a notification by marking it as read or done

state.description: The new state of the notification (read/done)

threadID.description: The ID of the notification thread

ToolSpecification.name: github___submit_pending_pull_request_review
ToolSpecification.description: Submit the requester's latest pending pull request review, normally this is a final step after creating a pending review, adding comments first, unless you know that the user already did the first two steps, you should check before calling this.

body.description: The text of the review comment

ToolSpecification.name: github___manage_repository_notification_subscription
ToolSpecification.description: Manage a repository notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete repository notifications subscription for the provided repository.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the repository notification subscription.

ToolSpecification.name: github___add_issue_comment
ToolSpecification.description: Add a comment to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_notifications
ToolSpecification.description: Lists all GitHub notifications for the authenticated user, including unread notifications, mentions, review requests, assignments, and updates on issues or pull requests. Use this tool whenever the user asks what to work on next, requests a summary of their GitHub activity, wants to see pending reviews, or needs to check for new updates or tasks. This tool is the primary way to discover actionable items, reminders, and outstanding work on GitHub. Always call this tool when asked what to work on next, what is pending, or what needs attention in GitHub.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are listed.

since.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time (ISO 8601 format)

before.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time (ISO 8601 format)

filter.description: Filter notifications to, use default unless specified. Read notifications are ones that have already been acknowledged by the user. Participating notifications are those that the user is directly involved in, such as issues or pull requests they have commented on or created.

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are listed.

ToolSpecification.name: github___delete_file
ToolSpecification.description: Delete a file from a GitHub repository

branch.description: Branch to delete the file from

path.description: Path to the file to delete

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_secret_scanning_alert
ToolSpecification.description: Get details of a specific secret scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___create_pull_request
ToolSpecification.description: Create a new pull request in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___search_code
ToolSpecification.description: Search for code across GitHub repositories

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

q.description: Search query using GitHub code search syntax

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_me
ToolSpecification.description: Get details of the authenticated GitHub user. Use this when a request includes "me", "my". The output will not change unless the user changes their profile, so only call this once.

reason.description: Optional: the reason for requesting the user information

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_pull_request
ToolSpecification.description: Get details of a specific pull request in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___delete_pending_pull_request_review
ToolSpecification.description: Delete the requester's latest pending pull request review. Use this after the user decides not to submit a pending review, if you don't know if they already created one then check first.

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_issues
ToolSpecification.description: List issues in a GitHub repository.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

ToolSpecification.name: github___push_files
ToolSpecification.description: Push multiple files to a GitHub repository in a single commit

files.description: Array of file objects to push, each object with path (string) and content (string)

ToolSpecification.name: github___update_issue
ToolSpecification.description: Update an existing issue in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_pull_request_files
ToolSpecification.description: Get the files changed in a specific pull request.

ToolSpecification.name: github___create_repository
ToolSpecification.description: Create a new GitHub repository in your account

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_secret_scanning_alerts
ToolSpecification.description: List secret scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

secret_type.description: A comma-separated list of secret types to return. All default secret patterns are returned. To return generic patterns, pass the token name(s) in the parameter.

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_branches
ToolSpecification.description: List branches in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_notification_details
ToolSpecification.description: Get detailed information for a specific GitHub notification, always call this tool when the user asks for details about a specific notification, if you don't know the ID list notifications first.

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_tag
ToolSpecification.description: Get details about a specific git tag in a GitHub repository

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_commit
ToolSpecification.description: Get details for a commit from a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sha.description: Commit SHA, branch name, or tag name

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_file_contents
ToolSpecification.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository

path.description: Path to file/directory (directories must end with a slash '/')

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_pull_requests
ToolSpecification.description: List pull requests in a GitHub repository.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

head.description: Filter by head user/org and branch

ToolSpecification.name: github___create_or_update_file
ToolSpecification.description: Create or update a single file in a GitHub repository. If updating, you must provide the SHA of the file you want to update.

sha.description: SHA of file being replaced (for updates)

branch.description: Branch to create/update the file in

path.description: Path where to create/update the file

ToolSpecification.name: github___mark_all_notifications_read
ToolSpecification.description: Mark all notifications as read

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

lastReadAt.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked (optional). Default: Now

ToolSpecification.name: github___request_copilot_review
ToolSpecification.description: Request a GitHub Copilot code review for a pull request. Use this for automated feedback on pull requests, usually before requesting a human reviewer.

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_pull_request_diff

ToolSpecification.name: github___create_issue
ToolSpecification.description: Create a new issue in a GitHub repository.

assignees.description: Usernames to assign to this issue

labels.description: Labels to apply to this issue

ToolSpecification.name: github___list_tags

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

ToolSpecification.name: github___create_branch

sort.description: Sort field by number of matches of categories, defaults to best match

ToolSpecification.name: github___update_pull_request

ToolSpecification.name: github___get_issue
ToolSpecification.description: Get details of a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

ToolSpecification.name: github___manage_notification_subscription
ToolSpecification.description: Manage a notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete a notification thread subscription.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the notification subscription.

notificationID.description: The ID of the notification thread.

ToolSpecification.name: github___create_pending_pull_request_review
ToolSpecification.description: Create a pending review for a pull request. Call this first before attempting to add comments to a pending review, and ultimately submitting it. A pending pull request review means a pull request review, it is pending because you create it first and submit it later, and the PR author will not see it until it is submitted.
